headline: The dual boiler that ends the compromise.
subheadline: Independent brew and steam boilers, a rotary pump, and an E61 group head. The Doppio is where single-boiler frustrations go to die.
hero_image_alt: Arco Doppio dual-boiler espresso machine in brushed steel on a dark kitchen counter, dual PID displays showing different temperatures, a perfectly textured milk pitcher beside a freshly pulled espresso with thick crema
description_long: If you've been waiting for your single boiler to cool down between brewing and steaming, you already know why the Doppio exists. Two independent brass boilers mean you pull a shot at one temperature and steam milk at another -- simultaneously, without compromise. The rotary pump is whisper-quiet and delivers pressure so consistent you'll wonder how you ever tolerated a vibratory. The E61 group head is the industry standard for a reason: thermal stability and a massive ecosystem of aftermarket accessories. This is the machine that turns frustration into satisfaction.
use_case_body: No more temperature surfing. No more waiting between shots and milk. No more rattling pumps. The Doppio's dual-boiler architecture, rotary pump, and E61 group head address every single pain point of a single-boiler setup -- and the difference is obvious from your very first shot.

social_proof_quote.quote: I upgraded from a Breville Bambino and the Doppio is a completely different experience. Simultaneous brew and steam changed my mornings. The rotary pump alone was worth the price of admission -- dead silent, rock steady.
social_proof_quote.name: Daniel W.
